page.title: 04Industry
page.content: Rochdale was renowned for its cotton industry but this has seriosly declined;approx. 5,000 being employed in 1985, which is 25% of the total employed 15 years ago. However, textiles still provide the main source of employment. Fothergill & Harvey are the largest employer-approx. 600 - manufacture synthetic fibres, with 70 to 80% of its out-put going to the Ministry of Defence. Several light engineering firms exist in the area,eg. Reynolds, Taylors, Ratcliffes etc. Unfortunately,Rochdale has one of the worst employment figures in the Greater Manchester Region;second only to Wigan and St Helens.On the 19th June 1985,the town's unemployment rate was 17.6% of the total work force, which amounts to 10,727.
